data.title: In extinction: only five players from the 90s remain active
data.text:
Time goes by. Behind the Elton Brand's recent withdrawal —and those of Kobe Bryant, Tim Duncan and Kevin Garnett— and the limbo by Andre Miller, only five players who debuted in the NBA in the XNUMXs are still playing today: Jason Terry, Dirk Nowitzki, Paul Pierce, Vince Carter and Metta World Peace.

Jason Terry

Terry, like Eltron Brand, also has 17 seasons in the NBA. He was drafted 1999th overall by the Atlanta Hawks in 72. Last year he played for the Houston Rockets, where he was a rotation guy. There he played 5,9 games and averaged 1,1 points, 1,4 rebounds and 17,5 assists in an average of XNUMX minutes per game. Jason Terry is still active and this summer he signed a contract with the Milwaukee Bucks.

The shooting guard has played 1.285 games in the NBA and has started 675 times. His career average is 14,3 points, 2,4 sacks and 4,1 basket attempts. His percentage is 44,4% on field goals and 37,9% from the perimeter.

Dirk Nowitzki

The German giant. With 38 years behind him, Nowitzki continues to be the reference for the Dallas Mavericks. He was chosen in the draft in 1998 by the Milwaukee Bucks, although in a three-way transfer between the Mavericks, Suns and Bucks, the Dallas team acquired the German's services. Nowitzki was named MVP in the 2006-07 season and won the ring in the 2010-11 season, when they won the NBA against Miami Heat by LeBron James. The center was awarded the Finals MVP award. The German has been called up for 13 All-Stars.

In the 2015-16 season, Nowitzki played in 75 games, averaging 18,3 points, 6,5 rebounds and 1,8 assists in 31,5 minutes. In his 17 years in the NBA, Dirk has participated in 1.340 games. His career average is 22 points, 7,9 caught balls and 2,5 basket passes.

Vince carter

Also known as 'Vinsanity', Carter plays for the Memphis Grizzlies. The one from Florida was chosen in the draft in 1998 by the Golden State Warriors, although he was traded to the Toronto Raptors (1999-2004) in exchange for Antawn Jamison. From there he was traded to other teams: New Jersey Nets (2004-09), Orlando Magic (2009-10), Phoenix Suns (2010-11) and Dallas Mavericks (2011-14). In the end he ended up in the Tennessee franchise. He also participated in 7 All-Star games with an average of 10,1 points, 2,6 rebounds and 1,9 assists.

Carter was elected'Rookie of the year' in 1999. In 2000 they included him in the third best quintet in the NBA and in 2001 they chose him for the second best quintet in the NBA. In the 2015-16 season, 'Vinsanity' played 60 games in which he averaged 6,6 points, 2,4 rebounds and 0,9 assists. Throughout his career, Carter has played 1.274 games, with an average of 18,8 points, 4,6 sacks and 3,4 basket passes.

Put World Peace

Next up is Metta World Peace. The 36-year-old forward was selected in the draft by the Chicago Bulls in 1999 and played for the franchise until 2001. In the 2001-02 season he was traded to the Indiana Pacers. In 2006 he was traded to the Sacramento Kings and in 2008 he ended up in the Houston Rockets. Already in 2009, the Lakers They hired the forward. Metta World Peace is still active in the Los Angeles franchise. World Peace has been chosen once for the All-Star Game in 2004, the year in which he was named 'Best Defender in the NBA' and chosen for the league's defensive team. He also won a ring with the Lakers in 2010.

In the 2015-16 season, the New Yorker played 35 games and averaged 5 points, 2,5 rebounds and 0,8 assists in 16,9 minutes per game. Metta World Peace has played a total of 966 matches. His career average is 13,5 points, 4,6 catches and 2,7 basket passes.

Paul Pierce

The last of all is 'The Truth', although he has already announced that he will retire next year. Pierce was drafted tenth overall by the Boston Celtics in the 1998 draft. He won the ring against Los Angeles Lakers in 2008 and was awarded the Finals MVP award. Pierce has been named an All-Star 10 times and has averaged 9,6 points, 2,6 rebounds and 1,8 assists. Currently 'The Truth' is active in Los Angeles Clippers.

In the 2016-16 season, Pierce played 68 games and averaged 6,1 points, 2,7 rebounds and one assist. The forward has participated in a total of 1.318 games. His average is 20 points, 5,7 ball catches and 3,6 basket passes.
